body_html: @ravigarg27 a dumb workaround (if your new values are not Variables you're going to compute gradients over) is to do something conceptually like A - bool(update!=0)*A + update, where update has same shape as A and all not updated entries are equal to 0; however, that is quite out of scope of this thread :)
body_text: @ravigarg27 a dumb workaround (if your new values are not Variables you're going to compute gradients over) is to do something conceptually like A - bool(update!=0)*A + update, where update has same shape as A and all not updated entries are equal to 0; however, that is quite out of scope of this thread :)
body: @ravigarg27 a dumb workaround (if your new values are not `Variables` you're going to compute gradients over) is to do something conceptually like `A - bool(update!=0)*A + update`, where `update` has same shape as `A` and all not updated entries are equal to 0; however, that is quite out of scope of this thread :)
